projects.title: Cave Echoes
projects.description: This game was made in the Unity Engine in less then 7 days for the Brackeys 2025.2 Game Jam. You are a starving fruit bat, taking a risk to eat some legendary berries that only grow inside a dark, dangerous cave full of obstacles, tight tunnels, and vicious enemies. Use echolocation to clear your way and stay out of danger. You get hit once, and it's back to the start of the level. I led the development of this game as the Lead Programmer.

projects.title: The Hungry Pufferfish
projects.description:
This game was made in the Unity Engine in less then 48 hours for the 2024 UdeM Game Jam. You play as a pufferfish tumbling down a series of hills, eating shrimps along the way to grow bigger in size. The heavier you are, the more chances you have to pass the various gates in your way. 
By using Unity's 2D physics engine, this game is meant to better understand the concept and application of momentum for University of Montreal's students.

projects.title: Container Farm Management
projects.description: This application was created with a team of classmates as my final project in John Abbott College. Created with .NET MAUI and Python, this application lets you connect to a physical container farm using Microsoft Azure's cloud computing technology, monitor its sensors and control its lock, alarm and lights.

projects.title: Android Storefront Application
projects.description: This application was created with a team of classmates as a project in John Abbott College. Created in Java with Android Studio, this application lets you see a mock storefront for a farmer's market. Users are allowed to look at a list of produce as well as add and remove items from the store. This is all implemented with an SQL database embedded into the Android device.
